queries.query_name: Non Kube System Pod With Host Mount
queries.description: A non kube-system workload should not have hostPath mounted

files.expected_value: Resource name 'ubiquity-k8s-flex' of kind 'DaemonSet' in a non kube-system namespace 'default' should not have hostPath '/var/log' mounted
files.actual_value: Resource name 'ubiquity-k8s-flex' of kind 'DaemonSet' in a non kube-system namespace 'default' has a hostPath '/var/log' mounted

files.expected_value: Resource name 'ubiquity-k8s-flex' of kind 'DaemonSet' in a non kube-system namespace 'default' should not have hostPath '/usr/libexec/kubernetes/kubelet-plugins/volume/exec' mounted
files.actual_value: Resource name 'ubiquity-k8s-flex' of kind 'DaemonSet' in a non kube-system namespace 'default' has a hostPath '/usr/libexec/kubernetes/kubelet-plugins/volume/exec' mounted

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.volumeMounts.name={{host-k8splugindir}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex-sidecar}}.volumeMounts.name={{host-k8splugindir}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex-init-container}}.volumeMounts.name={{host-k8splugindir}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{ubiquity-db}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity-db}}.volumeMounts.name={{ibm-ubiquity-db}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
metadata.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.volumeMounts.name={{flex-log-dir}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true

queries.query_name: Workload Mounting With Sensitive OS Directory
queries.description: Workload is mounting a volume with sensitive OS Directory

files.expected_value: Workload name 'ubiquity-k8s-flex' of kind 'DaemonSet' should not mount a host sensitive OS directory '/usr/libexec/kubernetes/kubelet-plugins/volume/exec' with hostPath
files.actual_value: Workload name 'ubiquity-k8s-flex' of kind 'DaemonSet' is mounting a host sensitive OS directory '/usr/libexec/kubernetes/kubelet-plugins/volume/exec' with hostPath

files.expected_value: Workload name 'ubiquity-k8s-flex' of kind 'DaemonSet' should not mount a host sensitive OS directory '/var/log' with hostPath
files.actual_value: Workload name 'ubiquity-k8s-flex' of kind 'DaemonSet' is mounting a host sensitive OS directory '/var/log' with hostPath

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{release-name-sanity-test}}.spec.containers.name={{sanity-test}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{ubiquity-k8s-provisioner}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity-k8s-provisioner}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex-sidecar}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{pre-delete}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{pre-delete-hook}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{ubiquity}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{ubiquity-db}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity-db}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex-init-container}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{pre-delete}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{pre-delete-hook}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{pre-delete}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{pre-delete-hook}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{ubiquity}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity}}.securityContext.runAsUser should be set to a UID >= 10000
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{ubiquity}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{ubiquity-k8s-flex-sidecar}}.securityContext.runAsUser is set to a low UID

queries.description: Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
The permission to create pods in a cluster should be restricted because it allows privilege escalation.

files.expected_value: metadata.name=ubiquity-helm-hook.rules.verbs should not contain the value 'create' when metadata.name=ubiquity-helm-hook.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'
files.actual_value: metadata.name=ubiquity-helm-hook.rules.verbs contains the value 'create' and metadata.name=ubiquity-helm-hook.rules.resources contains the value 'pods'

queries.description: Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.description: CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
